page.title: 12FARMING AND AGRICULTURE
page.content: Local agriculture consists mainly of small arable farms.The main crops are lettuce,cauliflower,cabbage,potatoes and rhubarb.In days gone by rhubarb was the main crop and a train called the{Rhubarb Special}took it to London. The land is farmed intensively by a small number of men who rely on mechanisation,chemical fertilizers and weedkillers.This means that the number of people invoved in farming is quite small. On the other hand allotments,where vegetables and flowers are grown,are still very popular.People tend to grow small amounts of various fruits and vegetables for their own needs.Pudsey people are also very keen gardeners. The most popular flower seems to be the rose.An elderly Pudsey lady has over 120 varieties of rose in her garden which delights her neighbours.
